Entries.default: You stand at a nexus, the origin point of the many speaking tubes which snake their way through the Collections. Its shape evokes that of a musical instrument.
[Read Tayn's spell into the aperture.]
[Read Llengrath's spell into the aperture.]
[Leave.]

After an extended pause, you hear a distant roar of confusion and distress from the Collections above. Rapid movement and conversation fill the hall. 

The prisoners have awoken.
After an extended pause, you hear a chorus of agonized screams fill the halls of the Collections. It cuts off swiftly and silence reigns anew.

A foul-smelling wind periodically gusts out of the instrument's many apertures. As you draw close, a rattling sound works its way down the stalk of tubes - like the clearing of an old and rusted throat.
[Inspect the instrument closer.]
[Reach down into the mouth of the instrument.]
The lip is caked with years of accumulated spittle from a perpetually-screaming, dirty mouth. You keep reaching until you're elbow deep.
[Reach in.]
[Pull back.] "Nope. Bad idea."
You pull your hand back and shake off a long, viscous trail of... Something.
You plunge your hand into the puddle. As you search around in the thick accumulation of goop, the liquid gathers around your hand with a gentle, but insistent tug.
The liquid clutches you by the wrist and forces an object into your palm. Something about the eagerness of the gesture makes your skin crawl.
Something in the body of this nexus amplifies the speaker's voice and carries it to every corner of the Collections.
If only you could mount this on the ship, the whole of the Deadfire would be your stage.
The instrument's core purpose seems to be manipulation and control.
You recite the words of the spell, hardly recognizing the voice that echoes down the lengths of the tube network as your own.
You recite the words of the spell, hardly recognizing the voice that echoes down the lengths of the tube network as your own.
Your fingers brush the surface of a warm puddle.
"This isn't a test you need pass, Watcher. No one holds a needle to your throat."
"Better you than me." Fassina leans over and observes your progress.
"Hey, so why do I try so hard at keeping you alive if you're just going to go sticking your arm down... Whatever that is?"
"Don't care for that arm, Duskspeaker? I'd've chopped it off had you asked."
Ydwin's right eyebrow arches. "Whatever you find down there, I hope it justifies risking a limb."
"Desgant, Watcher. Do not blame me if that machine eats your sword arm."
"Absolutely worth the risk, certainly." Ydwin frowns at the egg.
